trans-unit.source: How to Scale Encoding Reserved Units
trans-unit.target: How to Scale Encoding Reserved Units

trans-unit.source: Learn how to scale Media Services by specifying the number of On-Demand Streaming Reserved Units and Encoding Reserved Units that you would like your account to be provisioned with.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to scale Media Services by specifying the number of On-Demand Streaming Reserved Units and Encoding Reserved Units that you would like your account to be provisioned with.

trans-unit.source: How to Scale Encoding
trans-unit.target: How to Scale Encoding

trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: A Media Services account is associated with a Reserved Unit Type which determines the speed with which your encoding jobs are processed.
trans-unit.target: A Media Services account is associated with a Reserved Unit Type which determines the speed with which your encoding jobs are processed.

trans-unit.source: You can pick between the following reserved unit types: **Basic**, **Standard**, or **Premium**.
trans-unit.target: You can pick between the following reserved unit types: **Basic**, **Standard**, or **Premium**.

trans-unit.source: For example, the same encoding job runs faster when you use the **Standard** reserved unit type compare to the **Basic** type.
trans-unit.target: For example, the same encoding job runs faster when you use the **Standard** reserved unit type compare to the **Basic** type.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Encoding Reserved Unit Types](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/author/milanga).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Encoding Reserved Unit Types](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/author/milanga).

trans-unit.source: In addition to specifying the reserved unit type, you can specify to provision your account with encoding reserved units.
trans-unit.target: In addition to specifying the reserved unit type, you can specify to provision your account with encoding reserved units.

trans-unit.source: The number of provisioned encoding reserved units determines the number of media tasks that can be processed concurrently in a given account.
trans-unit.target: The number of provisioned encoding reserved units determines the number of media tasks that can be processed concurrently in a given account.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your account has 5 reserved units, then 5 media tasks will be running concurrently as long as there are tasks to be processed.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your account has 5 reserved units, then 5 media tasks will be running concurrently as long as there are tasks to be processed.

trans-unit.source: The remaining tasks will wait in the queue and will get picked up for processing sequentially as soon as a running task finishes.
trans-unit.target: The remaining tasks will wait in the queue and will get picked up for processing sequentially as soon as a running task finishes.

trans-unit.source: If an account does not have any reserved units provisioned, then tasks will be picked up sequentially.
trans-unit.target: If an account does not have any reserved units provisioned, then tasks will be picked up sequentially.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the wait time between one task finishing and the next one starting will depend on the availability of resources in the system.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the wait time between one task finishing and the next one starting will depend on the availability of resources in the system.

trans-unit.source: To change the reserved unit type and the number of encoding reserved units, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To change the reserved unit type and the number of encoding reserved units, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In the [Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **Media Services**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **Media Services**.

trans-unit.source: Then, click the name of the media service.
trans-unit.target: Then, click the name of the media service.

trans-unit.source: Select the **ENCODING** page.
trans-unit.target: Select the **ENCODING** page.

trans-unit.source: To change the **RESERVED UNIT TYPE**, press BASIC, STANDARD, or PREMIUM.
trans-unit.target: To change the **RESERVED UNIT TYPE**, press BASIC, STANDARD, or PREMIUM.

trans-unit.source: To change the number of reserved units for the selected reserved unit type, use the **ENCODING** slider.
trans-unit.target: To change the number of reserved units for the selected reserved unit type, use the **ENCODING** slider.

trans-unit.source: Press the SAVE button to save your changes.
trans-unit.target: Press the SAVE button to save your changes.

trans-unit.source: The new encoding reserved units are allocated as soon as you press SAVE.
trans-unit.target: The new encoding reserved units are allocated as soon as you press SAVE.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The highest number of units specified for the 24-hour period is used in calculating the cost.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The highest number of units specified for the 24-hour period is used in calculating the cost.

trans-unit.source: Quotas and limitations
trans-unit.target: Quotas and limitations

trans-unit.source: For information about quotas and limitations and how to open a support ticket, see [Quotas and limitations](media-services-quotas-and-limitations.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about quotas and limitations and how to open a support ticket, see [Quotas and limitations](media-services-quotas-and-limitations.md).
